intro: Silene surculosa, commonly known as the woolly mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar growth habits. Silene surculosa is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardiness.
